topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1989–1992, Volume XXXI, START I, 1989–1991
topic.body: This is the second of two volumes in the Foreign Relations series devoted to the START I agreement (the “Treaty Between the United States of America and the Union of the Soviet Socialist Republics on the Reduction and Limitation of Strategic Offensive Arms”), which President George H.W. Bush and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev signed on July 31, 1991.
topic.image-description: Book Cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1989–1992, Volume XXXI, START I, 1989–1991
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
